job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
IDR is partnering with a nationally recognized healthcare company headquartered here in Nashville to fill a
100% remote Site Reliability Engineer
position. Our client offers an innovative workspace, excellent PTO right out of the gate, casual dress code, and ample opportunities for growth and advancement. Our client has continually been recognized and received awards for customer and employee satisfaction. If you are looking a fast paced, highly innovative organization to work for --- we want to talk to you!
Position Overview for the Site Reliability Engineer:
Designs and implements automated systems to provision, configure, and update VMS, containers, and other infrastructure
Architects, builds, and improves an innovative observability platform that collects and aggregates IT services
Collaborates with other engineering teams to design scalable and sustainable systems architectures
Guides and instructs software engineering teams on exposing appropriate data points to provide clear availability and performance
Perform other duties and responsibilites as required, assigned, or requested
Required Skills for the Site Reliability Engineer:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
1-3 Years' experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps Engineering, or Software Engineering
Works to achieve operational targets, which has impact on the overall achievement of results for the team
Good communication and interpersonal skills
What's in it for you?
Ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment
Full Benefits; Medical, Vision, Dental, and more!
Opportunity to get in with an industry leading organization
Why IDR?
20+ Years of Proven Industry Experience in 4 major markets
Employee Stock Ownership Program
Dedicated Engagement Manager who is committed to you and your success
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
ClearlyRated’s Best of Staffing® Client and Talent Award winner 8 years in a row
